A great game overall and hands down the best asymmetrical game there has ever been. It's design is simplistic but refined. Playing survivor can get repetitive at times but the better you get at it the less it feels that way. Easy to play, hard to master. The licenses that they have acquired over the years are great and add to the overall experience. It will feel grindy but the progression is there. It always feels great when you unlock a new perk that you wanted to use on another survivor or killer. Highly recommend.

Honestly, the game isn't in its best state right now but after the 6 year stream, I have a lot of hope for the future of DbD. For that reason, I'm recommending it. New players might be a bit irritated by the stagnant gameplay but give it a chance. It's way more fun with friends (especially if you're not a bully squad and you just meme and dream). 

I main Legion so the rework definitely helps this review being positive. It's a refreshing take on Legion despite still being the noticably same character. I also play a lot of BOON GAMEPLAY so you know I'm such a fun survivor lol

But seriously, give the game a chance. It SHOULD become better in the near future.

A really fun game. Not pay to win unless you're talking about the killers, but even then its not entirely true. Each killer has a different ability, but they are similar in some ways. Its a really fun party game to play with friends. You can go at it alone too and still have a lot of fun. The tutorial sucks though. Its long and doesn't help when it comes to getting to know maps, and how to get around them quick, and how to manipulate the survivors or the killer into going exactly where you want them.

Overall its a really good game.

其实每个技能的强度根本就不一样啊，垃圾技能根本没人带，常用技能就那几个。能否为技能分级，让玩家可以携带更少的高级技能，可以携带更多的低级技能。我想这样的话，垃圾技能才能有更多的出场机会，玩法与技能搭配也会更有娱乐性。
In fact, the intensity of all skills is different. Whether all skills can be graded so that players can carry fewer high-level skills and more low-level skills. I think if so, the collocation between skills will be more interesting and diverse.

I don't really like the changes they made to this game over time. The removal of ranking, replaced with a hidden MMR, and the removal the ability to try and unhook yourself if you're the last survivor alive are the two biggest changes that I don't like. But it's a fun game to kill time with friends so I can't say I don't recommend it.

Dead by Daylight is one of the games ever made. The gameplay is there, and the graphics are visually within the game. There are sounds, and you can hear them. You can do things, and other things happen. Out of all the games ever made, Dead by Daylight is certainly one of them.
good and fun game with great DLCs :)

One of my all time favourite games. It is simple and repetitive in its core mechanics (which in this genre is actually part of its charm for me), but the variability that the killers, perks and player personalities provide leaves the game still feeling fun and fresh to me after over 1600 hours of gameplay. The devs are continually updating the game with new killers, survivors, maps and perks, as well as significantly improving upon old content.

The only negative of this game is that a sizable portion of the player base struggles to play the game as intended, with a lot of trolly survivors and killers that either prevent you from playing by excessively camping or don't try to kill you at all. Though, to be precise, that is more an issue with unprincipled and undisciplined children having access to the game than an issue of the game itself.
this game ruined my life

the amount of braincells ive lost to playing this game is immeasurable

Serious note, I wouldn't recommend this game if you get frustrated easily, not only do the devs not fix or optimize their sh-t they also struggle keeping up with hackers. Not all is bad though, I've made some amazing friends through this game and we all bonded over our general hatred for this game. There have been fun moments, but I find myself only really having more fun in custom games than in actual matches.
Sometimes playing the game is more exhausting than rewarding doesn't matter on what side you play on, I think it's equally draining. So like- no I don't really wanna recommend you the game, but hey if you hate yourself then by all means ignore me and feel free to keep playing, I sure as hell will.
fun

Warning: Playing killer at high-ish mmr may cause hypertension/strokes. 
Warning: Playing solo survivor at high-ish mmr may also cause hypertension/strokes.

All in all it's a great game but it has some glaring issues.
Main ones being; the overuse of the same 4 meta perks in higher mmr can make things boring and cause burnout for both sides, toxic swf's who think they're the second coming of christ because they can hold m1 and hit the space bar every few seconds, killers who will throw the game just to camp you on hook because their fragile egos were damaged when you looped them for more than 30 seconds, and the group of people who just take the game way too seriously on both sides. 

((The meta perk thing will hopefully not be an issue in the coming months as the devs said in the anniversary stream that they're reworking about 40 survivor and killer perks to combat the most used perks and allow for more perk variety in games))

The community gets a bad rep but it's really just the kids with the fragile egos who sit in the endgame chat and cry about how it's everyone else's fault that they lost and how other players aren't playing the game "the right way". There's a lot of cool people on this game on both sides. Just don't take it so seriously and take a break when you start to feel like you're gonna have a f###ing stroke.

TL;DR. It's an asymmetrical game so if you can't handle losing/get mad easily then this probably isn't the game for you.
